intro: Tunilla microdisca, commonly known as the miniature disc lily, is a rare and delicate plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Alstroemeriaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers with intricate patterns. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces tiny, white or pale yellow blooms. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tunilla microdisca is considered a conservation concern.
